segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 11
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 11

segments.pli: 2. Anussativagga

segments.pli: 17. Gopālasutta
segments.en: 17. The Cowherd

segments.pli: “Ekādasahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato gopālako abhabbo gogaṇaṃ pariharituṃ phātiṃ kātuṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, a cowherd with eleven factors can’t maintain and expand a herd of cattle.

segments.pli: Katamehi ekādasahi?
segments.en: What eleven?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, gopālako na rūpaññū hoti, na lakkhaṇakusalo hoti, na āsāṭikaṃ hāretā hoti, na vaṇaṃ paṭicchādetā hoti, na dhūmaṃ kattā hoti, na titthaṃ jānāti, na pītaṃ jānāti, na vīthiṃ jānāti, na gocarakusalo hoti, anavasesadohī ca hoti, ye te usabhā gopitaro gopariṇāyakā te na atirekapūjāya pūjetā hoti.
segments.en: It’s when a cowherd doesn’t know form, is unskilled in characteristics, doesn’t pick out flies’ eggs, doesn’t dress wounds, doesn’t smoke out pests, doesn’t know the ford, doesn’t know satisfaction, doesn’t know the trail, is not skilled in pastures, milks dry, and doesn’t show extra respect to the bulls who are fathers and leaders of the herd.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, ekādasahi aṅgehi samannāgato gopālako abhabbo gogaṇaṃ pariharituṃ phātiṃ kātuṃ.
segments.en: A cowherd with these eleven factors can’t maintain and expand a herd of cattle.

segments.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, ekādasahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu abhabbo imasmiṃ dhammavinaye vuddhiṃ virūḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjituṃ.
segments.en: In the same way, a mendicant with eleven qualities can’t achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.

segments.pli: Katamehi ekādasahi?
segments.en: What eleven?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na rūpaññū hoti, na lakkhaṇakusalo hoti, na āsāṭikaṃ hāretā hoti, na vaṇaṃ paṭicchādetā hoti, na dhūmaṃ kattā hoti, na titthaṃ jānāti, na pītaṃ jānāti, na vīthiṃ jānāti, na gocarakusalo hoti, anavasesadohī ca hoti, ye te bhikkhū therā rattaññū cirapabbajitā saṅghapitaro saṅghapariṇāyakā te na atirekapūjāya pūjetā hoti.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant doesn’t know form, is unskilled in characteristics, doesn’t pick out flies’ eggs, doesn’t dress wounds, doesn’t smoke out pests, doesn’t know the ford, doesn’t know satisfaction, doesn’t know the trail, is not skilled in pastures, milks dry, and doesn’t show extra respect to senior mendicants of long standing, long gone forth, fathers and leaders of the Saṅgha.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na rūpaññū hoti?
segments.en: And how does a mendicant not know form?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yaṃ kiñci rūpaṃ () ‘cattāri mahābhūtāni, catunnañca mahābhūtānaṃ upādāyarūpan’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant doesn’t truly understand that all form is the four primary elements, or form derived from the four primary elements.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na rūpaññū hoti. (1)
segments.en: That’s how a mendicant doesn’t know form.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na lakkhaṇakusalo hoti?
segments.en: And how is a mendicant not skilled in characteristics?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ‘kammalakkhaṇo bālo, kammalakkhaṇo paṇḍito’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant doesn’t understand that a fool is characterized by their deeds, and an astute person is characterized by their deeds.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na lakkhaṇakusalo hoti. (2)
segments.en: That’s how a mendicant isn’t skilled in characteristics.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na āsāṭikaṃ hāretā hoti?
segments.en: And how does a mendicant not pick out flies’ eggs?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu uppannaṃ kāmavitakkaṃ adhivāseti nappajahati na vinodeti na byantīkaroti na anabhāvaṃ gameti, uppannaṃ byāpādavitakkaṃ … uppannaṃ vihiṃsāvitakkaṃ …
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant tolerates a sensual, malicious, or cruel thought that has arisen. They don’t give it up, get rid of it, eliminate it, and obliterate it.

segments.pli: uppannuppanne pāpake akusale dhamme adhivāseti nappajahati na vinodeti na byantīkaroti na anabhāvaṃ gameti.
segments.en: They tolerate any bad, unskillful qualities that have arisen. They don’t give them up, get rid of them, eliminate them, and obliterate them.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na āsāṭikaṃ hāretā hoti. (3)
segments.en: That’s how a mendicant doesn’t pick out flies’ eggs.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na vaṇaṃ paṭicchādetā hoti?
segments.en: And how does a mendicant not dress wounds?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā nimittaggāhī hoti anubyañjanaggāhī;
segments.en: When a mendicant sees a sight with their eyes, they get caught up in the features and details.

segments.pli: yatvādhikaraṇamenaṃ cakkhundriyaṃ asaṃvutaṃ viharantaṃ abhijjhādomanassā pāpakā akusalā dhammā anvāssaveyyuṃ, tassa saṃvarāya na paṭipajjati; na rakkhati cakkhundriyaṃ, cakkhundriye saṃvaraṃ nāpajjati.
segments.en: Since the faculty of sight is left unrestrained, bad unskillful qualities of desire and aversion become overwhelming. They don’t practice restraint, they don’t protect the faculty of sight, and they don’t achieve its restraint.

segments.pli: Sotena saddaṃ sutvā …
segments.en: When they hear a sound with their ears …

segments.pli: ghānena gandhaṃ ghāyitvā …
segments.en: When they smell an odor with their nose …

segments.pli: jivhāya rasaṃ sāyitvā …
segments.en: When they taste a flavor with their tongue …

segments.pli: kāyena phoṭṭhabbaṃ phusitvā …
segments.en: When they feel a touch with their body …

segments.pli: manasā dhammaṃ viññāya nimittaggāhī hoti anubyañjanaggāhī;
segments.en: When they know a thought with their mind, they get caught up in the features and details.

segments.pli: yatvādhikaraṇamenaṃ manindriyaṃ asaṃvutaṃ viharantaṃ abhijjhādomanassā pāpakā akusalā dhammā anvāssaveyyuṃ, tassa saṃvarāya na paṭipajjati; na rakkhati manindriyaṃ, manindriye saṃvaraṃ nāpajjati.
segments.en: Since the faculty of the mind is left unrestrained, bad unskillful qualities of desire and aversion become overwhelming. They don’t practice restraint, they don’t protect the faculty of the mind, and they don’t achieve its restraint.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na vaṇaṃ paṭicchādetā hoti. (4)
segments.en: That’s how a mendicant doesn’t dress wounds.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na dhūmaṃ kattā hoti?
segments.en: And how does a mendicant not smoke out pests?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na yathāsutaṃ yathāpariyattaṃ dhammaṃ vitthārena paresaṃ desetā hoti.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant doesn’t teach others the Dhamma in detail as they learned and memorized it.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na dhūmaṃ kattā hoti. (5)
segments.en: That’s how a mendicant doesn’t smoke out pests.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na titthaṃ jānāti?
segments.en: And how does a mendicant not know the ford?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ye te bhikkhū bahussutā āgatāgamā dhammadharā vinayadharā mātikādharā, te kālena kālaṃ upasaṅkamitvā na paripucchati na paripañhati:
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant doesn’t from time to time go up to those mendicants who are very learned—knowledgeable in the scriptures, who have memorized the teachings, the texts on monastic training, and the outlines—and ask them questions:

segments.pli: ‘idaṃ, bhante, kathaṃ, imassa ko attho’ti?
segments.en: ‘Why, sir, does it say this? What does that mean?’

segments.pli: Tassa te āyasmanto avivaṭañceva na vivaranti, anuttānīkatañca na uttānīkaronti, anekavihitesu ca kaṅkhāṭhāniyesu dhammesu kaṅkhaṃ na paṭivinodenti.
segments.en: Those venerables don’t clarify what is unclear, reveal what is obscure, and dispel doubt regarding the many doubtful matters.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na titthaṃ jānāti. (6)
segments.en: That’s how a mendicant doesn’t know the ford.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na pītaṃ jānāti?
segments.en: And how does a mendicant not know satisfaction?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye desiyamāne na labhati atthavedaṃ, na labhati dhammavedaṃ, na labhati dhammūpasaṃhitaṃ pāmojjaṃ.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant, when the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One are being taught, finds no joy in the meaning and the teaching, and finds no joy connected with the teaching.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na pītaṃ jānāti. (7)
segments.en: That’s how a mendicant doesn’t know satisfaction.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na vīthiṃ jānāti?
segments.en: And how does a mendicant not know the trail?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ariyaṃ aṭṭhaṅgikaṃ maggaṃ yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant doesn’t truly understand the noble eightfold path.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na vīthiṃ jānāti. (8)
segments.en: That’s how a mendicant doesn’t know the trail.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na gocarakusalo hoti?
segments.en: And how is a mendicant not skilled in pastures?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cattāro satipaṭṭhāne yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant doesn’t truly understand the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na gocarakusalo hoti. (9)
segments.en: That’s how a mendicant is not skilled in pastures.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu anavasesadohī hoti?
segments.en: And how does a mendicant milk dry?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuṃ saddhā gahapatikā abhihaṭṭhuṃ pavārenti cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhārehi. Tatra bhikkhu mattaṃ na jānāti paṭiggahaṇāya.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant is invited by a householder to accept robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick. But they don’t know moderation in accepting.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu anavasesadohī hoti. (10)
segments.en: That’s how a mendicant milks dry.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ye te bhikkhū therā rattaññū cirapabbajitā saṅghapitaro saṅghapariṇāyakā, te na atirekapūjāya pūjetā hoti?
segments.en: And how does a mendicant not show extra respect to senior mendicants of long standing, long gone forth, fathers and leaders of the Saṅgha?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ye te bhikkhū therā rattaññū cirapabbajitā saṅghapitaro saṅghapariṇāyakā, tesu na mettaṃ kāyakammaṃ paccupaṭṭhāpeti āvi ceva raho ca, na mettaṃ vacīkammaṃ … na mettaṃ manokammaṃ paccupaṭṭhāpeti āvi ceva raho ca.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant doesn’t consistently treat senior mendicants of long standing, long gone forth, fathers and leaders of the Saṅgha with kindness by way of body, speech, and mind, both in public and in private.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ye te bhikkhū therā rattaññū cirapabbajitā saṅghapitaro saṅghapariṇāyakā, na te atirekapūjāya pūjetā hoti. (11)
segments.en: That’s how a mendicant doesn’t show extra respect to senior mendicants of long standing, long gone forth, fathers and leaders of the Saṅgha.

segments.en: And how does a mendicant know the trail?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ariyaṃ aṭṭhaṅgikaṃ maggaṃ yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant truly understands the noble eightfold path.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vīthiṃ jānāti. (8)
segments.en: That’s how a mendicant knows the trail.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu gocarakusalo hoti?
segments.en: And how is a mendicant skilled in pastures?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cattāro satipaṭṭhāne yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant truly understands the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu gocarakusalo hoti. (9)
segments.en: That’s how a mendicant is skilled in pastures.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sāvasesadohī hoti?
segments.en: And how does a mendicant not milk dry?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu saddhā gahapatikā abhihaṭṭhuṃ pavārenti cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhārehi.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant is invited by a householder to accept robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.

segments.pli: Tatra bhikkhu mattaṃ jānāti paṭiggahaṇāya.
segments.en: And that mendicant knows moderation in accepting.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sāvasesadohī hoti. (10)
segments.en: That’s how a mendicant doesn’t milk dry.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ye te bhikkhū therā rattaññū cirapabbajitā saṅghapitaro saṅghapariṇāyakā, te atirekapūjāya pūjetā hoti?
segments.en: And how does a mendicant show extra respect to senior mendicants of long standing, long gone forth, fathers and leaders of the Saṅgha?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ye te therā rattaññū cirapabbajitā saṅghapitaro saṅghapariṇāyakā, tesu mettaṃ kāyakammaṃ paccupaṭṭhāpeti āvi ceva raho ca, mettaṃ vacīkammaṃ … mettaṃ manokammaṃ paccupaṭṭhāpeti āvi ceva raho ca.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant consistently treats senior mendicants of long standing, long gone forth, fathers and leaders of the Saṅgha with kindness by way of body, speech, and mind, both in public and in private.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ye te bhikkhū therā rattaññū cirapabbajitā saṅghapitaro saṅghapariṇāyakā, te atirekapūjāya pūjetā hoti. (11)
segments.en: That’s how a mendicant shows extra respect to senior mendicants of long standing, long gone forth, fathers and leaders of the Saṅgha.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, ekādasahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu bhabbo imasmiṃ dhammavinaye vuddhiṃ virūḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjitun”ti.
segments.en: A mendicant with these eleven qualities can achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.”

segments.pli: Sattamaṃ.

sections.title: “Mendicants, a cowherd with eleven factors can’t maintain and…

suttaplex.blurb: A cowherd with eleven qualities is competent to look after a herd of cattle. Likelwise, a mendicant with eleven qualities can grow in the Dhamma.
